title: How Search Engines Work
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Search Engines Work usable.

hook.text: You type a query and get results in 0.3 seconds from billions of web pages. How?

buildup.text: Search engines build inverted indexes â€” maps from every word to every page containing it.

discovery.text: Your query hits the index, not the web. Ranking algorithms then sort results by relevance.

twist.text: The index must be constantly rebuilt as billions of pages change every day.

climax.text: Search combines indexing, ranking, caching, and distributed systems â€” dozens of algorithms in concert.

punchline.text: You search the index, not the internet.
